text: Buffet is great deal for the price with a good range of vegeterian ,chicken and goat items - especially liked were the Himalayan chicken and goat curry.  We are a non vegetarian family originally from India visiting from Austin, tx. Son and I ordered off the menu while the hubby and daughter went for the buffet. We ordered lassi, tomato soup, alu paratha and chai off the menu. Food is fresh hot and nicely spiced and came quickly to our table. Our server was friendly and chatty.

We went to the lunch buffet here. The food here was delicious. Gulab Jamun was good, Mattar Paneer was savory, and the Goat Curry was excellent. My girlfriend and I will be coming back and going to try to order off the menu next time. I recommend this place.

The food was okay and nicely seasoned. The atmosphere was sorely lacking. With us being the only ones in the larger restaurant before a larger group came in during what should've been the dinner rush, it made me wonder if they are even going to make it here. Next time, if there is one, we'll order take out as this is the closest Indian cuisine for us.

These restaurateurs are working very hard to make their place succeed.  The smells are delicious as you enter.  The decor is classy and welcoming.  Seating is comfortable.  

I had dinner with my son Sunday March 20.  We ordered a Nepali vegetarian thali and an Indian lamb korma.  I asked that it be mild, and everything except one of the thali dishes was perfectly spiced for my tastebuds.  My son ate the hot one.  The thali had four different dishes plus rice.  The lamb was a much larger portion than I usually see and was very good.  The whole meal, including tip and tax, was less than $40, and that included a chapati appetizer as well as some complimentary items: pakora before the main course and rice pudding for dessert.

Wow! The food is really cooked fresh, not pre-made and heated up, if you come for dinner. Not the place to go if you want to get served ten minutes after you place your order. I'm a soup fan and the lentil soup was fantastic. We came as a party of five celebrating a birthday and had gracious service and a variety of dishes, all excellent. This is also a good place to have a quiet dinner where it easy to have good conversation. The background music is very soft.

I'm so glad I found a great Indian food buffet lunch close to my work.   Very clean and the staff is great!   The food is delicious,  loved the Chili chicken, prefectly spiced.   At $9.99 for all you can eat you can't beat this place, check it out!

The entrees and Naan were delicious. The samosas were overcooked so they were hard on the outside, although the interior was good. We had a Nepalese goat dish, and it was wonderful, very flavorful. They just opened and they haven't gotten their permanent sign up (just a banner that's covering up the name of the Chinese business that used to be there), so the location was  little difficult to find. The service was wonderful, though. The prices were comparable to other Indian restaurants of similar quality. There were the usual tandoori and curry dishes you'd expect to see on the menu at an Indian place, but there were also Nepalese dishes that I hadn't seen before. The extra variety was nice. Overall I'd recommend giving it a try.

Very bad servicing for delivery.
1. They told credit card is not accepted so it was difficult to get cash.
2. We ordered 7 plates of momo for per person but we got it in just 2 box.
3. Too late for delivery. They told the food will be delivered in 1 hrs but it took 1 hrs 35 min. 
4. There were no spoon and other items to eat. Just only food.

Really loved the food here. I have been there twice, once for lunch buffet and then again went for dinner. Buffet was good, with great vegetarian options. For dinner, we tried their Nepali dishes and to my surprise they all were so flavorful. I highly recommend this place.
Amazing Nepali food. Especially the Goat Bhutan. Tried this for lunch and dinner. Felt like being back home in the mountains.

My sweetie and I decided to try Saino and loved it. The garlic naan, lentil soup, tikka masala, and Nepali veg thali were superb. The staff were upbeat, friendly, and constantly had genuine smiles. The place felt like home, family. I asked what "saino" means; the waiter said it means "relationship." A most apropos name for this somewhat tucked away gem of a restaurant. Will definitely return to try the buffet. Namaste. :)

Tried Saino for the first time today. Went for the lunch buffet. All in all, we were quite satisfied.
The assortment was ample and fresh. The service was very good and friendly. Our server was the owner's daughter. She was very informed and helpful. Will return soon for dinner and to order from a very abundant regular menu. Encountered absolutely no language barriers. One very positive note relates to the authenticity of this restaurant. They were fairly busy  for an ordinary weekday lunch. Seemed like almost all were regulars with a good number of them being either Indian or from Nepal. That is always something to look for in a place like this.
Great food, price and service!!!  I couldn't ask for more.  Very exceptional restaurant to have a filling meal.  This is a new favorite place for me.
Great restaurant with great buffet. Food choice was impressive and our server Reshma was friendly and accommodated our needs on the point. Thank you and it will be our stop again

We were vegas on a trip and we were craving for nepalese momo..i am nepali so i know what  is good momo and which one is okie..they are the best..the bhutan was too good..it tasted home made...people were super friendly..we felt like eating back in nepal..we were planning to visit them before leaving but we couldn't,if we are there again we will definitely visit saino..

Unless you are in the know, this is still a secret that's waiting to be discovered. Wow! The naan is cooked to order and the lunch buffet is very fresh - with an assortment of both veggies and meat dishes that are spicy and non-spicy, all flavorful dishes. Price is pretty reasonable for food of this caliber, but mostly though the service is Superb!

You guys really need to work hard on making those momos better. One of the reason people go to nepalese restaurant is to have momo and you guys really messed it up. Hopefully you will take this review in a positive way and try to improve the food.

Nice addition to the Vegas Indian/Nepali food scene. Steamed chicken momo to start was fantastic. Will definitely get those again. And a boneless goat dish that was seasoned incredibly was also good. Boneless lamb saagwala was also very good. 
Ordered our items at medium 5 spice, and it definitely had some kick. Will probably order a 3 or 4 next time. 
Time it took to get the order out was a bit long, but I will just assume they were taking their time to get it perfect. 

Definitely a place to add to your normal rotation for Indian food.

Just enjoyed a super tasty dinner here on Friday night!  I had the vegetarian thali and goat samosas and both were excellent.  It was hard to choose because the menu is extensive.  The restaurant is cute and the staff couldn't be nicer or more attentive.  (I found the two screens with Indian videos and Bollywood to be very entertaining as well). Highly recommend!
The waiter was so kind. The food was delicious and at a good cost. I ate goat curry, there And aaloo gobi.
This is a great spot for Indian food , very fresh food and helpful servers , I went a couple of times for the lunch buffet and I thoroughly enjoyed it , definitely recommend trying it .
Great new Indo Nepal spot!  Breads are great and have to have the tandoori mixed grill! Biryani and raita is very tasty. Heard the lunch buffet is great and what a deal.  Have to come back.
Awesome Buffet, the place was very nice and clean, the food was great and the service was excellent.

One of the best Indian/Nepali restaurants in USA. Me and my wife both enjoyed the food. I am nonveg and she is vegetarian. We tried vegetarian momos, gobi manchurian, vindi masala and dal makhani and all of them were cooked to perfection. I enjoyed Haddiiko soup as well. This is as close to food back in India or Nepal. Bonus - The hosts were awesome.
Thank you Saino for an Awesome food and service!!!!! Very clean place. Had a lot of different varieties of food to choose from.
Food was good, definitely worth it. Garlic Naan and the vegetarian spread was delicious.

Wow! Fantastic food! All the dishes in the buffet are perfect (for me-medium spiced). The Yelp reviews brought me here while in Vegas. The owners are gracious and accommodating. In a short time since opening, they have deservedly succeeded. The restaurant is clean, sophisticated in design and style and well-laid out. Bollywood musicals on their television. Marines! If you are coming to Vegas from PNDL and want authentic Indian-Nepalese food, forget the Casino buffets. This one is worth your while! Oorah!
Excellent taste and quality. Happy to find a reasonably priced lunch buffet. We will be back!!
It is the best food I've ever had! If you are looking for a relaxing night out come here!! Best food made to order and amazing service.
A good buffet with friendly service although I would like to see more variety on their buffet. All three times they offered the same choices. Quality is good and price very reasonable.

For someone who is Nepali it is a traditional food .. Really nice Nepali/ Indian restaurant in vegas. must go place.. I came with my family and had lunch buffet for only $9.95 . A variety of wide selection to chose from. Customer service is great. The server and owner both are really welcoming. They said it is a new place , recently opened , clean .. Less greasier food and healthier than most indian food cause it has twist of NEPALI food..GO GO GO !! You will know by yourself.
This is the best Indian-Nepali restaurant in las vegas i have ever been....i tried both veg and non veg items...both were delicious....momo and sekuwaa was the best part...

If you like real Pakistani/Indian food, this is the place to go.

I stop by for lunch, I had Onion Kulcha, Dal  and Rice

Food was prepare custom to my need and it was yam yam!

This restaurant has excellent food! I really enjoyed everything I tasted on the lunch buffet. The chai tea was very good. My kids had a mango lassi that they said was good. The waiter was attentive and kind.
We loved the garlic Naan.

I would not even give this place 1 star. First of all there were cockroaches everywhere. When we ordered our food the food was 1000000% out of those ready to eat packets. I know cause I have had those when I was a student. I came here cause I saw 99 reviews with 4 and a half star. But guess these reviews are damn fake. The food after we ordered cake almost 45 min later. She didn't even serve us with our appetizer on time. This was insane. Between 2 of us we paid $39 with tip and we had crap of a service and definitely bad food. 

I strongly recommend not to come here especially if you are hungry.

Whenever i visit this place, i feel realxed and always have a delicious nepali and indian food. The most important factor is there customer service they value their customer need and taste and according to it they give there best, i am convinced with that. Thank you, will vist soon.
Amazing food, good ambience and fantastic service. Visit and you won't be disappointed.

Wow! I can't believe we didn't try this place sooner!! We had the lunch buffet which was hot, fresh, and delicious. Fresh orders of Naan bread right to our table were included and did not disappoint. I can't wait to come back for more Tandoori Chicken!

I could not find a good Nepalis restaurant in Vegas until now. I had the buffet - good variety, cooked well, no excessive oil, and clean. I'm giving very good review for this Nepalis restaurant. Also not expensive.

I was super bummed to see that Cheerful House had closed, but Saino quietly opened in their space and their tasty food and attentive service make them a favorable replacement. Lunch is a super-cheap $10/pp for a selection of about 5 vegetarian and 5 carnivorous entree options, two choices of rice, and a fresh bar of vegetables and condiments. 

Selection may be a bit small compared to other spots in town, but these guys do everything well- the goat curry was easily the most meaty version I've found even including a la carte ordering, their raita was uniquely flavorful with fresh herbs, and naan was made fresh for the table. I'm an omnivore, but the palak paneer and gobi aloo are the stuff vegan dreams are made of! I wish they'd add to their appetizer/dessert items- I only found a single samosa and a tiny cup of rice pudding, and was sad not to be able to end my meal with gulab jamun. 

Saino is definitely worth a visit. Signage and decor indicate that they provide Himalayan and Nepalese cuisine but their current offerings seem to be mostly Indian cuisine. 

TIP: check in on the Yelp app for 15% off!
The lunch buffet is a good deal and very tasty. I also ate here for dinner and loved it. Lots of vegetarian options and the service is friendly. I would recommend this place to any of my friends.

Its hard to find authentic Nepali cuisine in Vegas but this place is a gem! The service is excellent and the food is a delight. Would recommend to anyone looking for well priced Nepali/ Indian food in Vegas.

Just...fabulous.  The food is so perfectly perfect, the people are so nice, place is spectacularly clean.  I love Indian food and we have several good places for Indian buffets here in Vegas, but Saino Indian Nepali Kitchen is my new favorite.  I sure with they had beer, though.  If I could have Taj Mahal beer with my Saino food I'd be totally blissed out.

Awesome lunch buffet! Highly recommend this place. Isn't easy to see from the road, but definitely worth the effort to drive into the shopping center. Service was excellent our server was very attentive and courteous. Buffet price $9.95 pp and has many choices. It has become one of my favorite lunch hangouts.

Excellent service! They were super friendly and came to check if everything was good. The food was delicious and had more flavor than other Indian lunch buffets; I prefer my food a little more on the spicy side. Garlic naan bread with butter was great. Definitely should check this place out.
It's the first time my boyfriend and I come here to eat their food ! The food is awesome , and the service is super nice ! We'll definitely come back

Very nice new restaurant.  Lunch buffet is $9.95, very reasonable, plus 15% off if you check in with Yelp (for now.)  About 8 vegetarian and 5 non-vegetarian dishes that rotate daily, plus salad and fresh naan.  Everything we tried was very tasty.

Quick in and out if you have a tight lunch schedule.  Music at a good level, enough to provide atmosphere and also allow talking at the table.  Service is prompt and friendly, the people here are very nice.

It is a little hidden, it can't easily be seen from the street on far Northwest corner of the Smith's shopping center, facing Decatur.

This past Sunday my daughter and I decided on Indian food for our early dinner. After perusing the Yelp! site I was delighted to find an Indian and Nepali lunch buffet with great reviews only a couple of miles away.
     Off to Saino! We got there about 12:30 and were immediately  seated at a corner table, fully set with linen. Pretty impressive for a lunch buffet.
     As a worker in the food industry for forty years, I was duly impressed with the quality and freshness of the food on the buffet.
    My daughter and i are both big fans of goat and the goat curry did not disappoint. The vegetable dishes may have been even more impressive. I could have filled up on those alone. Especially  the navataran korma and the pakora. Oh yeah, plenty of warm , fresh naan was brought to the table as well.
     And our server, Reshma, what can I say? She was a jewel. a sweet ingenuous young woman who was genuinely happy to answer my questions about the dishes on the buffet and put up with my silly jokes.
   All in all, a delightful experience. Will have to go back some night and try the ala carte menu.
Definitely will return for the buffet.

Ordered my food for pick up online.  Arrived 15 mins later and the place had no idea I placed my order. (Without an apology). Replaced my order and was told it would be 10-15 minutes. Totally ok. 

After 20 mins of waiting for take out the host comes to inform me the Fish Pakora appetizer was unavailable and I could choose someone else or get a refund. I choose the veggie dumplings.

30 mins later I received my food.  Got home and tasted my food and realized the curry I ordered at the "very spicy" level (most spicy you can order) had no spice at all. 

After not having received my order, waiting 20 mins to tell me there was no fish pakora and having zero spice in my curry- I was pretty frustrated.


In reply to your comment about my review.....it's definitely ok that you never got the message from Yelp. What's not ok is to tell me the food would be 10-15 mins later after I placed the order, then tell me 20 mins later there's no appetizer I ordered and then wait another 30 mins to get my food. After all that I got home and had zero spice in my food. So it's not about the EAT24 problem. The problem is with the service I received from YOUR restaurant.

I really do enjoy Indian cuisine but just like any other type of food, the cook has their own style. I have a favorite Indian place that I am used to in AZ. The food is good here but some of the things like the mint sauce, which is traditional, I just like the way that some other places make it. Overall, good food and friendly people here.

Best vegetable korma I've ever had, and the chicken tikka was well up there. Spotlessly clean, gracious service. My naan was so fresh I couldn't eat it for a few minutes without burning my fingers. I came for Saturday buffet brunch and wrote this specifically because my experience was so antithetical to that of the reviewer who gave two stars the day before. Absolutely worth the price for the lunch buffet.

Great food..had lunch buffet with parents visiting from India
Malai kofta was outstanding !
Chai was made on request and was awesome

I was a little nervous pulling up, as the location leaves a lot to be desired but this is one restaurant that should not be judged by outside or location.  We arrived just after dinner service started and had the place to ourselves.  I chose the non-veg Saino set which included goat bone soup, chicken tikka masala, lamb samosa, rice, lamb josh curry and naan.  One of the best Indian set dinners I ever had.  I chose medium heat, spicy, and I'd probably notch it down a touch next time-still delicious; our waiter was kind, gracious and helpful.  The restaurant is clean, quiet and the food is out of this world.  We will be returning.

Not my first choice for Indian food. First things first, there was a hair in my food. Secondly, my Mango Lassi was sour... excuse given to me was they use "rose water" in the lassi to make it "taste different!" 
Third no no was we ordered garlic naan and their was no garlic on it. Should I go on to fourth and fifth issue? Ohzz yes I shall! Fourth, my Malai Kofta tasted like chalk. Let's say this isn't even good enough to be the equivalent to Indian "fast food!"

The place is completely hidden at the Smith complex. Way behind smith. I almost give up to look this place and finally I found. You  will be surprised as they make the authentic Nepali food and they are quality of food is really good. I highly recommend this little family restaurant and they even offer buffet.
Great indian food. We had buffet lunch. Good options in both veg n non veg categories. Nan was super soft. Its only $9.99 and 15% discount on yelp checkin.
My husband and I love Indian food, we go often in CA, so we decided to try this restaurant.  We had the lunch buffet. Delicious, good variety and good quality.

I just called the number listed on their FB. Turns out they are closed temporarily. The number was a personal number of a woman who works there (not sure who exactly),but she said they should be reopening in 2 weeks or so (it is 6/19/17 today).

We were looking for good Indian food and came across Saino. We were expecting average joint as Vegas is not exactly known for Indian food. To our surprise food was one of the best we ever tasted. Chef kept things simple and closest to recipes we know as home cooking and since ancient times. We liked so much that we went their twice during our short trip.

Their menu is rather large, skip few pages and go to Nepali cuisine part. Their momos were heavenly. Especially all of their sauces were made from scratch and elevated food to another level.

A must try out place, service was super friendly, food is awesome and comforting, overall wonderful experience!!!

Great job Saino! Please maintain what you have going on there!

I was really craving indian food last night and found myself at saino. I must say i am not the type to write reviews like at all yet here I am. I loved it. I wasn't too sure at first me and my friend were the only two in there. But our waiter Pravin who is from nepal spoke very good english, was so attentive and made us feel very welcome. The food was tasty i ordered the tikka masala and my friend the goat. The goat was a tad chewy but the flavor was nice. I couldn't stop eating naan, rice, chicken, and an appetizer made from lentils served with a spicy and sweet sauce on the house! I will definitely return. It may have just opened but Saino is making a name for itself.

We loved this place! We ordered the Chicken Tikka Masala and Lamb Vindaloo. They were served with rice. And we had to get a side of the garlic Naan bread. All of it was so good.

The service was great.  It's clearly family owned and our servers were so nice.  Drinks always filled. The place was quiet so we could have a conversation. And very clean.  

We will definitely go back!

Chicken Momo's and Goat curry very flavorful and tasty. New place must try.
Customer Service very good.
Wonderful lunch from a new Indian Nepalese restaurant right by Chinatown. Great food and service. Will be back!
We had such an amazing meal! We had the chicken masala and chicken Korma. It was delicious. The garlic naan was incredible also. We will definitely be back for our date night.

Fresh amazing flavors.  Everything homemade.  Will return many more times.
ONLY $9 for Indian buffet.  Amazing deal.

Saino Indian-Nepali Cuisine is a wonderful restaurant on West Desert Inn. Came here with a friend and had an awesome dinner.we had Baigan Barta, Aloo Gobi, Basmati Rice, Chicken Tikka Masala and Garlic Naan. The service was wonderful as was the atmosphere. We will definitely be back!

I like this place, considering it's only 9.95 and 15% off with Yelp check in. The food is great and the the staff is incredible. Everyone was nice. They don't have a large selection like other Indian buffets, but sometimes smaller is better because they can make everything amazing! The mango lassi was on point. It was the best one in town that I have tried. This place is a mixture of Indian with Nepali food. The mint chutney is really good there. It has a kick that I love. The inside is cozy and the bathrooms are extremely clean. It seems like a small family owned place, which I always support. I will definitely be back. Don't forget to ask for the garlic naan.
Food was very good and very tasty.. Best stop in Las Vegas to have a tasty and authentic food. Hoping to see such restaurants in the NJ side...

What caught my attention was Nepali food. I never had Nepali food before. I came here for dinner with some friends. 

The place is clean. It is run by a Nepali family. I asked the waitress for recommendations on Nepali food and she suggested the ones that I end up ordereding.

I liked Haddiko Soup that is a goat bone soup. It is a popular nepali soup specially prepared of bone marrow of goat with mild nepali spices. However, I didn't like Goat Bhootan. I thought I would try something unusual such as this dish that is a special nepali dish where stomach, liver, intestine and lungs of goat will be fried along with nepali spices, fashioned with onions and cilantro and it was served with rice.

Garlic Naan, they were warm and soft whole-wheat flour bread topped with garlic and cilantro.

My friends loved their food too. I heard they have Nepali music and dance on weekends and also
have Goat curry on Buffet during lunch which I would love to return for. Keep up the great experience!

In an attempt to give this place a fair shake I sat back and thought, what I can do to highlight the positives about this experience? The food  is not overly flavorful and not terribly bland, yet lacks the expected spice entourage associated with Indian Cuisine. The Lassi be it salt or Mango is sour. I personally did not mind it much though it was unexpected. My guests were not so impressed. 
The Garlic Naan was very mild and our Mali Kofta was neutral on the flavor scale. The Paneer Tikka fell in the same neutral category though the cheese was very plump and firm. 

No dessert on this visit.

If you enjoy neutral flavors and do not deal with spice well this may be a good place to go. With such a diverse selection of Indian Cuisine in Las Vegas it fell in the lower spectrum in comparison though I would consider bringing a hesitant friend with a soft palate here.

Everything we ordered was so deliscious.  Our server Rehhshma was  very helpful about  explaining dishes. Nice clean restaurant.  I like the fact it's Nepalese, Indian and hymalaian.  It's a very good restaurant.  Nice addition to Las Vegas. I will definitely be back.
Attentive and friendly staff. Very clean and quiet. Mango lassi was incredible. Will definitely be back
This is my new favorite buffet to go to. The food is excellent and delicious. It's quiet and homey. Love this place. Can't wait to come back again. I recommend this place for lunch.

There is a lot going on here that is good but the negatives pull the rating down.  Four of us gathered here and ordered extensively from the menu.  Items ordered:

Onion bhajji
Vegetable pakoras
Aaloo jeeraa
Garlic naan
Chicken fry momo
Dhindo
Tandoori mixed grill
Tandoori roti
Paneer kulcha
Goat bhootan
Kheer
Suji haluwaa
Papadam served with mint and tamarind chutneys (house provides)

The standouts were the onion bhajji, aaloo jeera, dhindo, and goat bhootan.  The potatoes of the aaloo jeera were nicely seasoned.  The dhindo is an interesting dish of millet stirred with hot water that comes out looking like a mound of not so good looking dark mashed potatoes.  By itself, there's not much flavor, but the goat bone soup, mustard greens, and spicy ginger served with it gave it a great flavor--especially the goat bone soup.

The goat bhootan was one of my top picks of the restaurant  The dish consists of goat stomach, liver, intestine, and lung.  The liver was especially flavorful.  A do again dish.  Another pick was the onion bhajji while the vegetable pakoras were good but standard for any Indian restaurant.

The negatives for Saino come from the service and the billing.  We had to ask for water refills, there was a language problem at times, being out of stock on one of the few desserts, and last but not least--being charged for items not ordered and not delivered a fact I noticed when I got home.  The dessert we ordered that they were out of was charged anyway.  We ordered steamed momo and we got fried instead of steamed.  That may have been a language problem but we were charged for both steamed and fried.  We had not ordered the fried.  In addition, the restaurant was uncomfortably warm with thermostat turned quite high and the few ceiling fans not able to keep the place within comfort zone for me.

I do want to go back and see what the lunch buffet is like and the items I mentioned above as my favorites are worth a return for them.  I'll be more careful before paying the next time.

My first time going to this place. I went during buffet hours. Tried the rice, Himalayan chicken, chicken masala and tandoori chicken. Good amount of spice. The Naan was my favorite. Very soft. My server was very courteous and stopped by my table once in a while to see if I needed anything. Overall, love the food and service.
Probably the best indian food i have had in Vegas. Service was brilliant and friendly. Keep up the good work guys

Oh boy, I was very excited to go to this place because my fellow yelpers have said nothing but nice things about this place. I also really like Indian food. I went today at 2pm for the lunch buffet. The restaurant had a table of 8 and a table of two they were already eating. You have to wait to be seated and I stood there long enough to were I almost walked out. I was finally seated and she said she would bring me water. I understand that the buffet ends at 3 but the food in the warmers was very low and it had that crust along the edges of the pans that happens when stuff sits to long. Ok so I was starving and I got my first plate and went back to my seat and I had no water or server. I was looking around the restaurant and there was 3 dirty tables no one was cleaning them . I finished my first plate and oh look there is the lady that works there she is talking to the table behind me holding the water picture.                 She said oh sorry here is your water. I went up for another plate and out of no where the only employee in the place came out with a plate of white rice she said would you like some before I fill it in the warmer tray I said sure. I went to sit down and she asked if I would like some naan I said yes and once again she took forever to come back with a water refill and naan.            

I'm a pretty fair yelper I think this is my longest review and that would be because this is the worst place I have been to. The tables that were dirty stayed dirty. The lady that was working took time to remove the tip from one of them but she didn't clean it. The food tasted good but for me if I have shitty service the food doesn't matter. I ate fast and I got out of that place. I seriously won't be surprised if the health department shows up there or it will probably be on dirty dining. I still have faith in my fellow yelpers and maybe I went on a off day meaning everyone was off except that lady that really didn't give a shit about her customers. I hope the next one I do is better.
Best food in las Vegas. Everything they had for buffet was delicious. Will go back here whenever I visit Las Vegas again

Hands down to best nepali food in town...be it khasi ko bhutan or sekuwa or taas...they never fail to impress us..been there twice..although the first experince was bittersweet..the second one restored my faith in them...makes u feel as if u are in nepal...will go all the way there just for their nepali food..and dont forget the momos

i just had my dinner there yesterday. very good food very nice service. dishs u should order momos. goat karahi, and chic curry. outstanding. i will b visting soon  

thank u guys for wonderful food and serive

I have eaten here twice. First, Thursday lunch and then Saturday dinner. They have a buffet at lunch time, but not in evening. Food was really good. I recommend butter chicken, garlic naan bread, tandoori chicken, and gulab jamin. I don't know names of other food. Buffet under $10. Diner for two ran around $35. There is a Yelp discount for checking in, but didn't use it because server already gave discount without asking. Also, only charged for half the items. Gave free appetizer crackers, rice, and two desserts. Wife does not like Indian food, but she really like this place. We have already made plans to go back again. Staff was super, super friendly. Our server was the nicest man. Dinner took a long time and we never saw another guest. The place was totally empty. Even lunch buffet was almost empty. It's a shame this place is so empty because the food, service, and prices are terrific. I'm worried they might go out of business before they are discovered. So, have lunch there and see for yourself.

Had the lunch buffet.  Delicious!  Even though we went late for lunch and the trays were low, the very friendly and attentive waiter asked if there was anything else that we wanted, he could have the kitchen resupply.  Excellent service!  We'll be back.

My husband and I travel all over the country. For many years our tradition is to eat Indian food everywhere we go. This is by far the BEST Indian restaurant we've visited. The lunch buffet is TDF! 

We had garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, chili chicken, tandoori chicken, the veggie mix, and both of the dessert options. Anytime we visit Vegas we will be sure to stop here.

It's so hard to find good Indian food in Vegas... But this place has changed everything for me! It's only been open for 4 months but the food is amazing and it's on a good side of town. The food is clean and authentic. Would recommend this place to any Indian cuisine lovers
Went in for the lunch buffet with a Groupon.  Very good food, great source and excellent service.  Will definitely be back.

What a deal! Only $9.95 for a lunch buffet full of choices and of good quality. My favorite was definitely the Saag paneer, followed by either than tandoori chicken or the goat curry. 

I will mention that most of these dishes packed some heat. It was almost too much for someone like me. But I'm sure most others would appreciate it. 

We visited on a Saturday around noon and the place was mostly empty our entire time there. One waitress took care of everyone. She must have been bored because she was overly attentive and on the awkward side. 

Also, I asked for a cup of water to go and they happily provided me with a bottle!

My boyfriend and I order the same thing every time and it has never disappointed us :) 

1. Lamb Samosa 
2. Garlic Naan x2 
3. Lamb Tikka Masala 
4. Rice 

We usually come here for dinner because of our busy schedules but they have a lunch buffet special we need to try because it's only $9.95

Our favorite server is Prabin!! 
He always serves with a smile and is the most polite and kind person ever :)

I don't know for lunch but there is no dinner buffet.  My dish must have been the lunch  reheated in the microwave. Chicken in the dish was so dry even the sauce could not cover it.  

Of all food, Indian is the biggest hit or miss that I have had, any more misses than any other.
Surprisingly amazing food.. authentic indian cuisine.. perfect buffet menu and very good service.. very friendly people.. calm and smiling at you, make you feel at home.

Walk in and smell the spices!  The food really is as good as it smells.  Not crowded and so much value.

You get a basket of complimentary grill crackers with a chutney and sweet sauce.

Appeitizers
-garlic naan
-paneer samosa
-onion bhajjai

Entrees
-Swordfish tikka masala (spice level 3/10 was a little low and barely noticeable)
-Goat curry with bones (spice level 4/10 was perfect)

Total meal was $37 after Yelp checkin 15% OFF offer.  Fantastic price for dinner for two.  Next time we come back, we'll try the Nepali Thali, which is a sampler plate with 8-9 things on it.  Goat Sekuwa  (skewers) also looked appetizing, $15 for four good size skewer.
This place was awesome! The food selection was great and the staff was even better. If you want a great lunch buffet and amazing food this is the place.

Cute family owned Indian/ Nepali food. So yummy and affordable. $9.99 lunch buffet. 
 I'm not familiar with any of the names but I tried everything on the buffet line, all delicious.
Get the garlic naan! They make it fresh and it comes to your table hot. 
Will come back and try the mango lassi next time. :)

Btw I tried mt. Everest afterwards and I think their buffet menu has a lot of the same items and I didn't notice much difference in quality or taste. It costs $1 less here so I'll just come here from now on instead!

We had come in and the restaurant was empty so i thought it was kind of weird since the place had good reviews. We decided to stay and eat anyway. The food was delicious and fresh. The seasoning is a little spicier than other Indian buffets which was a plus for me. The service was excellent. They constantly asked us how everything was and kept up with our drinks. I'm glad we gave this new place a chance. The grand opening price is great as well! $9.99 and 15% off with a Yelp check in! It's a great deal!

Signage outside can be confusing. Chinese or Indian? Haha if you thought you were getting Chinese food you thought wrong. I'm guessing it was a Chinese restaurant previously before this place opened and the pictures are still there. 

We came in on a Sunday afternoon and the place was dead. That can be a good and bad thing at a buffet. Good thing being no lines or people to bother you. Bad thing could be the food might be old. We didn't need to worry about long lines but the food was definitely not old! I was happy to see the sweet rice and of course chicken tikka masala. One thing I've steered away from before was the saag paneer which was really delicious. They had a vegetarian kofta in a curry type sauce that was pleasantly delicious for being vegetarian. I didn't try the lamb or goat but was told it was alright by my significant other. Of course we had all the fixings with garlic naan. No other way to wash it down with nothing less that a mango lassi. I did forget to use our 15% off with yelp check in but maybe I'll use it again in the future. Service was spot on but of course we were the only diners. I'd say it's competing with my other favorite Indian spot Delhi. We'll see how they do!

Conversation with waiter this week:

Me: "Hey do you guys have a dinner buffet?"
Waiter: "Yes, also dinner buffet"
Me: "How much is the dinner buffet?"
Waiter: "$9.95"
Me: "Same items pretty much?"
Waiter: "yes"
Me: "Wow, you guys are the only Indian restaurant in town to offer a dinner buffet."

(Finished meal)

Me: "Hey that was good, I'll definitely be back with some friends for your dinner buffet."

(Fast forward to Friday)

I cut my workout early and raced over to Saino to meet friends at 7pm since I had plans later at 9pm.

We get there...no buffet.

I said, "I was here on Monday and was told by the waiter via a full discussion that you guys offer an indian buffet for dinner."

Lady: "No, we don't have an Indian buffet for dinner."
Me: "Never? Why would your waiter tell me that?"
Lady: "No, we don't."

I don't get the point of wasting people's time with incorrect information, having me disappoint my friends with your incorrect information to get them in the restaurant (and have them order off the regular menu). We left.

The waiter obviously knew I was talking about a buffet at dinner time because he said it was the same price as the price of lunch.

The price of 9.95 is good...but go to Mt Everest or Mint for a couple dollars more for a much better buffet. The food is notches above this one and I can't stand having my time wasted.

I gotta be honest- I don't know the difference between Nepalese food and Indian food. All I know is that this is hands down the best Indian food in this city. It's not even a contest. We had lamb samosas, vegetable samosas with like a salad and yogurt on top ( I forgot the name of the actual menu item, but it's the 4th appetizer down) garlic naan with butter and the butter chicken. All were ridiculously delicious. The vegetable samosas with the yogurt were so flavorful and fresh. The lamb was so rich and moist. The naan was spot on and hot and fresh. The butter chicken was so rich, and coconutty - AMAZING!


The best part was- the service exceeded the food. I just can't believe what a great experience this was. 

Definitely on our regular restaurant rotation now.

My husband and I had Lamb Rogan Josh, butter chicken, and lamb korma. All three were very good. Our server was friendly and our food served promptly. The menu had a large selection of items and prices seemed competitive. My husband and I plan to try to the lunch buffet in the future so we can try more dishes. They only lost a star due to ambiance.

While driving through the area and starving, we found this place through Yelp search. Located in an obscure part a shopping center on Flamingo and Decatur, they apparently just opened recently. For lunch they have a lunch buffet comprised of many Indian dishes like chicken korma, creamy spinach, fried vegetables, chicken vindaloo, goat curry, etc. There's also a small salad bar on the side. The food was really good and the price was decent.

Items Tasted:
Papadum with Tamarind and Mint Chutney, Vegetarian Pakora, Onion Bhajji, Garlic Naan, Aaloo Jeeraa, Fry Chicken Momo, Dhindo, Tandoori Mixed Grill Platter, Tandori Roti, Paneer Kulcha, Goat Bhootan, Suji Haluwaa, Kheer

Located on West Desert Inn Road, directly across from I-Naba which oddly features a South Decatur Boulevard address, Saino Indian Nepali Kitchen is not the sort of place patrons 'stumble upon' as the storefront is hidden well off both Streets behind a Sinclair Gas Station, yet claiming to be the first Nepalese/Himalayan Restaurant in all of Las Vegas the concept seemed worthy of investigation.

Thus far gathering much of its attention for a $9.95 lunch buffet, the still-labeled hot and cold tables showing the selection to be "good, but mostly traditional Indian" by a friend familiar with such things, the decision to partake in dinner at Saino was driven largely by the staff's inability to answer E-mails or explain by phone whether A la Carte options were offered from 11a-3p, the 6 o'clock arrival seeing five sat at a round table without a single other patron present until a quarter past seven.

No doubt a sizable menu, all items detailed with lengthy descriptions that often proved inaccurate as pictures of some helped guide choices both at the table and on the wall, those looking for attentive service are probably best to avoid Dinner at Saino as the waiters seem more intent on standing about chatting with colleagues or adjusting Indian Pop-Music than they are with refilling beverages or assuring accuracy to the tickets, water requiring repeated requests on more than one occasion while double charges were made for items not received - some sold out and another never requested.

 Not an expensive place, the waiter's reference to Sysco and US Foods during a discussion not unexpected but at the same time not "brag-worthy" as he made it seem, the meal started off predictably with crisp Bread served alongside Tamarind and Mint Chutney, the first courses delayed due to difficulty firing the Tandoori despite an arrival almost an hour after opening, another odd statement as the crispy Pakora and Onion Bhajji were both fried, anyway.

Ignoring the ubiquitous spelling mistakes on the menu, but more perplexed by the number of items with inconsistent pricing online versus the menu versus the bill, follow-ups to the tasty fried vegetables were delivered as a slow rollout with Garlic Naan that was typical, if not particularly memorable, a large plate of Aaloo Jeeraa providing the meal's first 'wow' moment by way of texture and the complexity of the spice profile while Chicken "Mo-Mo" was served fried as opposed to boiled, as requested, though perusal of the menu after leaving would show the table was charged for both.

Told that the signature Dhindo would take an hour to prepare, high heat and constant stirring turning Millet into a sort of mashed Root Vegetable texture that may not look all that appealing but springs to life when mixed with Bone Marrow fortified Goat Curry and pickled Vegetables, the Mixed Grill of Tandoori skewered Meats was tender, moist and well flavored with sizzling Bell Peppers and Onions that made vaguely resembled Fajitas, a particularly amusing association as the arrival only shortly preceded a basket of soft Roti that had been ordered much earlier in the meal.

Not served the Vegetarian Curry advertised with Dhindo, listed pickles omitted with several other plates, it was not really a shock that no rice arrived with the Goat Bhootan and although the very concept of this dish will likely be met by disgust by most diners the diversity of flavors and textures found amidst stewed Goat Offal was actually quite exemplary, the minerality of liver at times a touch harsh while alveolar tubes presented like well cooked calamari, all beneath a bold veil of spicing.

Particularly impressed by Paneer Kulcha, soft pockets of cheese baked right into the soft bread, desserts were a bit disappointing, particularly as Saino was "sold out" of Gajar Halva that the table was still charged for, the Suji Haluwaa something never seen prior but faintly resembling polenta in its texture while Rice Pudding was watery and just fair-to-middling.

THREE AND A HALF STARS:  A very worthwhile stop based only on the quality of cuisine, Saino Indian Nepali Kitchen's failures by way of service even prove a challenge to those expecting nothing more than the basics.  Not particularly 'shocking' in some ways, but at the same time not at all acceptable considering the omissions, overcharges and general lack of speed, one must assume the Lunch Buffet precludes some of these problems, though a la carte is the only way to order most of the more interesting and authentic Nepalese plates.

Not knowing until the other day that this Indian restaurant is just around the corner from work, we decided to check it out for a carry-out order.

The young lady working that night was very friendly and had our food bagged and ready to go shortly after arrival.  Carry-out was quick and simple.

As for the food, it's pretty darn good.  The chicken saag I had was full of flavor (though it could have been a tad spicier).  The vegetarian aloo dish we ordered was extremely good as well.  The naan was also quite tasty.

For the two of us, we dropped an easy $30 without drinks (wish it were a tad more affordable) but overall we liked the place.

Amazing food and service! My girlfriend and I come here almost every week to have dinner. We always get lamb samosas, garlic naan (yum), lamb tiki masala and side order of basmati rice. This place serves the best lamb, it's so juicy and flavorful. Definitely recommend this place to anyone who has a serious craving for Indian food

HOME AWAY FROM HOME......
Was in Las Vegas for a week vacation,.... being Nepali... as usual was craving for Rice and Daal... was googling for Indian Restaurant to kill the crave and luckily found Saino... what a find... made winner even though I did not win anything at Gambling. :-)
Very very clean place with extra ordinary food quality. 
Prabin Bahi and Reshma Bahini will make your day, very very nice people. 
Alright... Now back to Saino. 
Run by Nepali family and all foods are created with love. Had Khasi ko Sekuwa, Bhutan and Goat Curry... Never used to order Goat Curry since most of place use Lamb.. But there it felt like Dansai... So any Nepali in Las Vegas area even for a day.. I request you to Stop @ Saino that will be make you trip a worth. 
For any other foodies who are not authentic Nepali with Nepalese test buds... still recommend you to stop by for healthy clean and Superb Food with extraordinary service... 
I pray for Saino to Keep on putting smile and do what you are doing.. And you are the best and thank you for great evening and Awesome Lunch too. 
By the way they have Goat curry on Buffet (during Lunch) too... :-)

In a search for the best Indian restaurant in Vegas, from the point of view of a Desi, this place deserves the highest marks. The food is quality, fresh, and delicious. The chef knows what he/she is doing. The dishes are well spiced made with crisp, fresh vegetables. They are fairly priced with a classy ambience. Most importantly, they don't over oil their food. Their hospitality is above and beyond the best restaurants in town. I recommend this place to anyone looking for a refreshingly tasty Indian food.
My new favorite Indian restaurant! Their tikka is amazing so buttery and creamy. Service and food A+. The place is a little hidden and easily missed so keep an eye out.  I highly recommend!

Is this place really closed ? Or have they moved locations ?
It is my favorite Indian place , the butter chicken and garlic butter naan are so savory and delicious . I need my fix
Phenomal food, very high quality and authentic, impressed. Even the buffet was killer!!
